page.title: 10ST.MARY'S PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built in 1976 and can hold 245 children.At the moment there are about 200 pupils aged between 4 and 11 years.Each year group has its own teacher and there are 7 classes.Beside the basic subjects of maths and English,the children are taught swimming,games,environmental studies,art,music and religious education.From here pupils go on to one of the secondary schools in Oldham.The school has 3 BBC-B computers which the children use from 5 onwards.The school pets are hamsters,goldfish and tropical fish. The school has had 2 headteachers.
